name: The Mauryan Empire
description: Explore the legacy of one of India's greatest empires, with its capital in Pataliputra.
detailed_account: Founded by Chandragupta Maurya, the Mauryan Empire became one of the largest empires in ancient India. Under Emperor Ashoka, it reached its zenith, establishing a unified administration and spreading the principles of Dhamma across the subcontinent.

name: Rise of Buddhism & Jainism
description: Bihar as the cradle of two major world religions.
detailed_account: Magadha emerged as the spiritual epicenter of ancient India. Siddhartha Gautama attained enlightenment at Bodh Gaya, while Vardhamana Mahavira propagated Jainism, shaping global spiritual thought.

name: Gupta Dynasty Golden Age
description: An era of scientific, cultural, and academic excellence.
detailed_account: Often called the Golden Age of India, the Gupta period witnessed major advancements in mathematics, astronomy, philosophy, and art. Institutions like Nalanda flourished under royal patronage.

name: Nalanda University
detailed_account: Nalanda attracted scholars from China, Tibet, Korea, and Central Asia. Its massive libraries and structured education system made it the greatest academic institution of the ancient world.

name: Ancient Vaishali Republic
description: One of the earliest republics in world history.
detailed_account: The Licchavi republic practiced a form of democratic governance with elected assemblies. Vaishali was also significant for hosting the Second Buddhist Council.

name: The Pala Empire
description: A dynasty that strengthened Buddhist learning.
detailed_account: The Palas ruled eastern India and patronized Mahayana Buddhism, founding major institutions like Vikramshila University and fostering intellectual exchange with Southeast Asia.

name: Sher Shah Suri’s Administration
description: Administrative reforms that shaped modern governance.
detailed_account: Sher Shah Suri introduced standardized currency, efficient revenue systems, and the Grand Trunk Road, laying foundations later adopted by the Mughals.

name: Champaran Satyagraha
description: Gandhi’s first major movement in India.
detailed_account: This non-violent protest against British indigo exploitation marked the beginning of mass civil resistance in India’s freedom struggle.
